root.name: Dark Fall: Lost Souls
root.description: OverviewDark Fall: Lost Souls is a horror adventure game for the PC. Developed by Darkling Room and published by Iceberg Interactive, Lost Souls was released on December 4, 2009. The game's story was written by Jonathan Boakes, author of "The Lost Crown". The game takes place in and around the fictional English town of Dowerton. The game is played from a first-person perspective, and players take on the role of an anonymous "Inspector" looking into the disappearance of a girl named Amy Haven. The story follows on from the events of the first Dark Fall game, The Journal.System RequirementsOS: Windows XP / Vista / Windows 7Processor: Intel Pentium IV at 1.5Ghz or equivalent AMD (or better)Memory: 512 MB of RAM for Windows Xp / 1 GB for Windows Vista / 7Hard Disk Space: 1.5 GBGraphics Card: 128 MB Nvidia Geforce Go 7300 / ATI Radeon 9250 (or better)Sound Card: DirectX 9 CompatibleDirectX: Version 9.0c
